{{confusing|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox software | name = Tango Desktop Project | logo = [[File:Tango-logo-bw.svg|150px|Tango logo]] | screenshot = [[File:Tango-example icons.png|292px]] | caption = Example of the Tango Icon Library | author = | developer = [http://tango.freedesktop.org/The_People Tango Project contributors] | released = {{Start date and age|2005}} | latest_release_version = | latest_release_date = | latest_preview_version = | latest_preview_date = | frequently updated = | programming language = | operating system = | size = | language = | status = Active | genre = [[Computer icon]]s | license = Icons: [[Creative Commons license|CC-by-sa]] 2.5
Icons since v0.8.90: [[Public domain]]
Icon Naming Utilities tool: [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] | website = http://tango.freedesktop.org }} [[File:Tango pallette.svg|290px|thumb|right|The Tango Desktop Project's [http://tango.freedesktop.org/Tango_Icon_Theme_Guidelines#Color_Palette Color Palette]]] The '''Tango Desktop Project''' is an [[Open-source software|open-source]] initiative to create a set of design guidelines and to provide a consistent [[user experience]] for applications on [[desktop environment]]s. The project has created a set of [[computer icon|icon]]s known as the Tango Icon Library, which is described as a "proof of concept".{{cite web |url=http://tango.freedesktop.org/Tango_Icon_Library |accessdate=2011-06-15 |title=Tango Icon Library - Tango Desktop Project |date=2010-08-11 }} The Tango Desktop Project is a project of [[freedesktop.org]], and is closely linked with other freedesktop.org guidelines such as the [http://freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/icon-theme-spec Standard Icon Theming Specification]. == Objectives == The key objective of the project is to allow developers to easily integrate their software (in terms of appearance) with the desktop. The visual inconsistencies that arise from different [[Freedesktop.org|desktop]] environments ([[KDE]], [[GNOME]], [[Xfce]]...) and custom distributions make it hard for third parties to target [[Linux]]. Ideally, any project that follows the Tango guidelines will have a [[look and feel]] that matches well with other icons and applications that follow the guidelines. The style does not aim to be visually unique to distinguish itself. Instead, a secondary aim of the project is a style that makes applications look appropriate running on operating systems common at that time, such that [[Independent software vendor|ISV]]s will find that their application does not look out of place on [[Windows XP]], [[Mac OS X]], [[KDE]], [[GNOME]], or [[Xfce]]. Apart from the visual guidelines, the project aims to provide a set of common metaphors for the icons. Tango follows the Freedesktop.org's [[Standard Icon Theming Specification]] and actively develops the [[Freedesktop.org]]'s [[Standard Icon Naming Specification]], defining names for the most common icons and the used metaphors. Many free software projects, such as [[GIMP]], [[Scribus]], and [[GNOME]], have started to follow the Tango style guidelines for their icons.[http://tango.freedesktop.org/Tango_Showroom Tango Showroom - Tango Desktop Project] Also, [[Mozilla Firefox 3]] uses Tango icons when it is unable to find the user's installed iconset, and also for icons not covered by said iconset.{{ cite web | title = A first look at the Firefox 3 visual refresh for Linux | url = http://blog.mozilla.com/faaborg/2007/11/13/update-on-the-firefox-3-linux-theme/ | date=2007-11-13 | accessdate=2008-07-11 | first = Alex | last = Faaborg }} It is also possible for proprietary closed source applications to use Tango Desktop Project icons. Examples highlighted by the Tango Showroom include VMware Workstation 6 and Medsphere OpenVista CIS. == History == In 2009, the original Tango icons were released into the [[public domain]] in order to make their implementation easier, due to the [[copyleft]] aspects of the [[Creative Commons]] [[Creative Commons licenses|license]] (Attribution-ShareAlike) they were previously released under. == Palette == This is the [[hexadecimal]] color [[Palette (computing)|palette]] used by the Tango Desktop Project, organized by color group and brightness:[http://tango.freedesktop.org/Tango_Icon_Theme_Guidelines#Color Tango Icon Theme Guide]
{| class="wikitable" style="color:white;text-align:center;width:50%;" | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Butter | style="background: #fce94f; color: #555;" | fce94f | style="background: #edd400; color: #555;" | edd400 | style="background: #c4a000;" | c4a000 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Orange | style="background: #fcaf3e; color: #555;" | fcaf3e | style="background: #f57900; color: #333;" | f57900 | style="background: #ce5c00;" | ce5c00 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Chocolate | style="background: #e9b96e; color: #555;" | e9b96e | style="background: #c17d11;" | c17d11 | style="background: #8f5902;" | 8f5902 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Chameleon | style="background: #8ae234; color: #555;" | 8ae234 | style="background: #73d216; color: #555;" | 73d216 | style="background: #4e9a06;" | 4e9a06 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Sky Blue | style="background: #729fcf;" | 729fcf | style="background: #3465a4;" | 3465a4 | style="background: #204a87;" | 204a87 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Plum | style="background: #ad7fa8;" | ad7fa8 | style="background: #75507b;" | 75507b | style="background: #5c3566;" | 5c3566 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" | Scarlet Red | style="background: #ef2929;" | ef2929 | style="background: #cc0000;" | cc0000 | style="background: #a40000;" | a40000 |- | style="color: #555; font-weight:bold; width:100px;" rowspan="2" | Aluminium | style="background: #eeeeec; color: #000;" | eeeeec | style="background: #d3d7cf; color: #000;" | d3d7cf | style="background: #babdb6; color: #333;" | babdb6 |- | style="background: #888a85;" | 888a85 | style="background: #555753;" | 555753 | style="background: #2e3436;" | 2e3436 |}
